PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [61f96f8bc4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13887/commits/61f96f8bc4e3942d9f9101814d1f23cdbbfbec02)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ ContinuousMap.HomotopyEquiv.NonemptyDiffeomorphSphere`
`++ instance (n : ‚Ñï) :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

What do you think about something like this:
```lean
def TopologicalPoincareConjecture (n : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
    ‚àÄ (M : Type u) [TopologicalSpace M] [T2Space M] [ChartedSpace ‚Ñù‚Åø M],
    M ‚âÉ‚Çï ùïä‚Åø ‚Üí Nonempty (M ‚âÉ‚Çú ùïä‚Åø)

def SmoothPoincareConjecture (n : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
    ‚àÄ (M : Type u) [TopologicalSpace M] [T2Space M] [ChartedSpace ‚Ñù‚Åø M]
    [SmoothManifoldWithCorners (ùì° n) M],
    M ‚âÉ‚Çï ùïä‚Åø ‚Üí Nonempty (M ‚âÉ‚Çò‚üÆùì° n, ùì° n‚üØ ùïä‚Åø)

proof_wanted TopologicalPoincareConjecture.proof : ‚àÄ n, TopologicalPoincareConjecture n

proof_wanted SmoothPoincareConjecture.not_seven : ¬¨ SmoothPoincareConjecture 7
```
etc

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9741923903/job/26882123040)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9741923903/job/26882123842)

Ha, lovely!

I think it is probably a good idea to introduce:
```lean
class IsHomotopySphere (M : Type*) [TopologicalSpace M] (n : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
  nonempty_homotopyEquiv : Nonempty (ContinuousMap.HomotopyEquiv M S)
```
and
```lean
class IsTopologicalSphere (M : Type*) [TopologicalSpace M] (n : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
  nonempty_homoeomorph : Nonempty (Homeomorph M S)
```
I'll have a proper look this evening when I have some time (and try to remember if there was a reason I used structomorph rather than diffeomorph when I was over in ICERM).

Only a few weeks ago, I saw reports that Xu (and collaborators) had resolved the final 125-dimensional case ‚ÄºÔ∏èhttps://www.math.princeton.edu/events/computing-differentials-adams-spectral-sequence-2024-05-30t170000 and https://bsky.app/profile/mikehill.bsky.social IIUC this resolves Conjecture 1.17 in the affirmative --- incidentally the opposite of what I was expecting / hoping ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

Thanks! Extracting the definitions seems to be a good idea, though I'm not sure they should be classes. It turns out Metric.sphere is already available in the Homotopy/Equiv file, but not in the Homeomorph file.

I think using `Structomorph` does make the statement shorter, because we're using a single model space rather than two (there's an [implementation note](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/Diffeomorph.html#Implementation-notes) about this).

From my reading of p.12,15,31,33 of https://math.mit.edu/~mbehrens/presentations/Exotic_spheres.pdf, I think the resolution of the Kervaire invariant one problem in dimension 126 doesn't settle additional cases of smooth Poincare. Recall the smooth structures on $S^n$ are in bijection with a certain group $\Theta_n$. The existence of a 126-manifold with Kervaire invariant one means that the subgroup $\Theta_{125}^{bp}$ is zero, so $\Theta_{125}$ is isomorphic to $\pi^S_{125}/J$, but we already know $\Theta_{125}\ne0$ (i.e. smooth Poincare is false for $n=125$, Proposition 1.12 in the 61-stem paper). So the odd case is already settled in the 61-stem paper.

For even $n$, $\Theta_n^{bp}$ vanishes and $\Theta_n$ is isomorphic to $\pi^S_n/J$ or an index-2 subgroup of it, and the latter only happens if if $n\equiv 2\pmod{4}$ and Kervaire invariant one exists in dimension $n$. The new result implies it's index 2 in dimension 126, so it seems more likely to be trivial, but Isaksen and Xu already showed smooth Poincare fails ifor $n=126$ (Theorem 12.6, https://arxiv.org/abs/1708.06854v4). The same paper settles the even case in dimensions below 140, and remaining task is to show $\pi^S_n/J$ is nontrivial for even $n\ge 140$, which reduces to stable homotopy group computations.

I've switched to using notations and now I can just write `Nonempty (M ‚âÉ‚Çï ùïä‚Åø)` for homotopy spheres and `Nonempty (M ‚âÉ‚Çú ùïä‚Åø)` for topological spheres, and I'm not sure whether to extract these definitions at this time ...
~~I'm not using the [diffeomorphism notation](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/739a018e1c14b34b2efccad6e4c0b1cdbf9fa671/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/Diffeomorph.lean#L182) because it doesn't look pretty ... Maybe it could also switch to the superscript parser (so could `ùì° n`).~~ I'm now using the notation since I don't need a superscript if the order of differentiability is infinite (i.e. smooth).

It seems you introduced the notation ùìñ somewhere in your talk, which isn't available in mathlib. It seems I have to write `Structomorph (contDiffGroupoid ‚àû (ùì° n)) M ùïä‚Åø` which is longer than the Diffeomorph version, so I'm not changing this.
Thanks for all the explanation, very much appreciated!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Geometry/Manifold): state generalized Poincar√© conjecture
